title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
Hi Team,

I have a 82-3462 board that Fans pulsing in loop

PPVCORE_S0_CPU: 0V
PPVCORE_S0_AXG: 0V

PPBUS_G3H: 12.59V
PP3V42_G3H: 3.431V
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.336V
PP5V_S5: 5.035V
PP3V3_S5: 3.341V
PP5V_S4: 5.035V

PP3V3_S4: pulsing
PP5V_S3: pulsing
PP3V3_S3: pulsing

P5VS3_EN: pulsing
PM_SLP_S4: pulsing

SMC_BC_ACOK: 3.4V
SMC_PM_G2_EN: 3.428V
PM_BATLOW_L:0V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 0V
PM_SLP_SUS_L: 0V

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3.429V

Y5010: 12Mhz
SMC_CLK32K : 32Khz
3 25Mhz signal pulsing

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3.429V

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: Does CPU VCore pulse as well?

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
No it's not pulsing,
Cpu vcore is missing

message:
"PM_BATLOW_L:0V

Are you sure?
Board should not even try to start...

Maybe getting some pulses there too?

message:
ola amigos,

I've re-mesured again, i had the same voltage for PM_BATLOW_L then suddenly it turned high.......maybe i'm too tired......sorry
here are the voltages......

PM_BATLOW_L: 3.336V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 3.397V
PM_SLP_SUS_L : 3.340V

ok so let me going through the others PCH Inputs page 18, or if you have any suggestion.....

thanks

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
Any pulse at pin 7 of U7950?
Pins 1 & 2 should be high or pulsing at least.

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
at pin 7 of U7950: no pulse 0v
Pins 1 & 2 are pulsing

At U7400
PP5V_S0_CPUIMVP is pulsing

at Q7860
PP5V_S4_P5VS0FET: pulsing
PM_SLP_S3_R_L (P5VS0_EN): pulsing

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: PM_SLP_S5_L pulsing......................back to PCH again......any suggestion?

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: Around the PCH, I've found L3508 missing but this one only provides the 5V to the camera, and not sure that it is responsible of my issue, however I'll replace it tomorow as it's starting to be late here in France.

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
"at pin 7 of U7950: no pulse 0v
Pins 1 & 2 are pulsing"
If gets power on pin8, then pin7 should pulse too.

Check pin8 solder, change U7950 if needed.

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
Ola 2Informaticos,
que tal?

I've repaced U7950 from a donor board, now pin 7 is pulsing too......a good thing done gracias, but still in the same "mode" ( quarter fan spin in loop)

when i plug the charger it rises to 2.3V then drops, then when the quarter fan start his cycle, it pulses from 0.085v to 0.150V

Any suggestion?

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: Did you try original 85w charger?

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
Ola 2Informaticos,

Im using a DC power supply with original 85W cable because of the tip, as you know it contains a chip that is talking with the machine with the one wire protocol.

Regarding the chip , I've just replaced the bios chip from a donor board, of course I did all the dumping/cleaning tasks with the medusa 2 before soldering it.

And you know what: It's working fine .......muchas gracias, that board was there for months now......;):D

I'm so happy .

Again thanks a lot muchas gracias..

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L

;)

message:

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
The board is starting but the fans slowly run to full speed......wht the easiest way to diagnose?
should I installed it in the machine and run the ASD or is there another way to find out as the board is on my desk........
I've connected  the LIO board and it's still the same.

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
That is RIO board, not LIO.
Connect it and try ;)

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: It was the trackpad, after i've connected it, fans run normally........there is a sensor in the trackpad.......ooops

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message: Palm Rest temp sensor is there; as its name is very "indicative"...

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
"what do you think about working with a dc power supply with a original magsafe 1 85W cable and official magsafe 1-->2 adapter."
I do NOT recommend that.
I just remember someone wasting 2 days with two boards repaired.
He tested them only with MagSafe 1->2 adapter and got problems; with backlight I think, don't exactly remember.
All fine when he tried with correct MagSafe...

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
thanks for your confirmation, I've also already read somewhere in the forum that those adapter ( even official ) are not reliable .............
So my next step will be to try to found an official 85W magesafe 2 cable, to attach to my DC Power supply, like that I will have both

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
regarding the magsafe 1 -->2 adapter here what I've found on the Apple official web site:

[B]Compatibility[/B]

24-inch Apple LED Cinema Display

27-inch Apple LED Cinema Display

Apple Thunderbolt Display

Apple 45W MagSafe Power Adapter

Apple 85W MagSafe Power Adapter

MacBook Pro with Retina display

MacBook Air with MagSafe 2 power port


So now we know that this little adapter is not comptible with the 65W charger

title: 820-3462  Missing PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN,   PM_SLP_SUS_L
message:
Don't bother too much with compatibility.
MagSafe original 85W charger is a MUST, both 1 and 2 style, for a service!
You can also need 85W cables to connect bench power supply.
This way you can discard an input leakage issue...
